title: Whats the status for our Shuriman Emperor, Riot?
body:
I had posted earlier wondering if Azir would receive buffs, morello responded that he would, and he did. He's sitting at an OK 46% win-rate in ranked right now which is a a sign that he needs love in my opinion, are you guys working on him at the moment/is he on your agenda?

In URF he is killer, but I can't live up to my username right now in Ranked matches because he is a seriously niche pick right now. I think he COULD fit into all team comps if he got a little love but he needs too much help early game. While I think he does need to have a weak early game like all Shuriman hyper carries, his laning phase is too weak to handle some of the popular champions right now in the mid lane.

Just wondering if he is on the radar for buffing/changing right now, would love a response. Cheers!

replies.body:
We're currently letting him sit as he is for a while, to assess both the impact of the 5.5 buffs and to see how the changing state of the game (tank jungler return and Athene's buffs) affects him. 

As far as win rate goes that's a data point that needs to be treated with caution, particularly on an extremely high mastery curve champion like Azir. A 46% average win rate for example could be associated with a champion that's weak or with a champion that's balanced (or even strong), whose average performance statistically gets dragged down by players new to that champ. 

As far as being able to be picked into any team comp that's something we'd like to avoid where possible. It suggests a champ lacks sufficiently clear strengths and weaknesses which results in a champ that gets picked all the time if they're strong, leading to games that feel very similar to each other.

Yeah, that's a good point, too few team comps being relevant's also a problem.  If a champ's only effective under certain extremely narrow cirumstances they're probably lacking a necessary tool and/or extremely feast or famine. I don't think that's the case for Azir, that's just a personal estimate based off his recent state though.
:/ Like soraka? who seems to fit in only a couple of team comps
Soraka's getting about as much Riot discussion as Cass, now. Not a good look.

Soraka doesn't need it though.

She is good in any team with CC and armor/MR. She is good agaisnt Assassins.
Ineresting, then, that in this tank meta which still has room for picks like Zed and Ahri, Soraka still isn't getting picked literally ever.

It baffles me really.

 Or well when I see her, I see her build wrong (no AP), probably the reason.

Right, as of right now Azir really only works with team comps that have heavy frontline - at least that's been my experience with him. Even poke-comp teams that you would think he could slip into don't really provide enough defense for him (and that's saying something, considering he has a built in wall to chuck at people). 

Has there been any consideration to buff his Q slightly, since that's an ability he relies tremendously upon? To say its base damage was severely reduced with the intention to turn it into a simply repositioning tool with no actual compensation is kind of unfortunate. It doesn't really have any significant range anymore, no significant damage without a Luden's Echo, and it still has a fairly high mana cost and cooldown. Orianna's Q, another "repositioning" move does more damage, has a lower mana cost, and a lower cooldown -  wouldn't it be nice if Azir's repositioning tool were at least on par with Ori's? Why have a champion based on positioning if his basic positioning ability isn't that great, useful, or reliable (frankly)?

I think there are way more ways to counterplay azir than there should be. Since Azir can be compared to a sustained DPS champion let's compare him to an ADC for example. An ADC has to worry about 2 things, doing dps while having good position. This can involve kiting or dashing to a different area to get a new area of advantage while still shooting. 

Now Azir on the other hand has to worry about 3 things. Soldier position, Azir's position and DPS. Azir's dps relies on soldier position. if they are out of soldier range, Azir needs to relocate his soldiers with Q which is on a pretty large cooldown being such a necessary skill. Also putting down a new soldier puts Azir in a dangerous location. The soldier planting range is very low. Most of the times waiting for Q to relocate your soldier is the only and best option. During this time the enemy is DPSing and relocating simply by right clicking somewhere or using a dash ability.

Currently, Azir relies on enemies being stationary or being held down by some CC to DPS. He can maybe build burst but then his gameplay is simply a worse version of Orianna. Orianna can reposition her ball much easier have more burst with Q W and has tankiness to get in closer with her shield.

It just seems like Azir is worse at both roles.

WAIT WHAT :D PIGEON GOD YES! I mained Azir before his nerfs so I feel like I should chime in, the nerfs at first were over the top, and he was brought back to an OK position, but not great, he deserved some nerfs, specifically in the tower destroying department.

What I never understood is they said he was a lane bully and a carry, thing is everyone in midlane is a lane bully and a carry, that's sort of the point of midlane, it's a lane where champions are constantly poking each other in lane so they can get the advantage and carry, you see this with {{champion:238}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:103}} ect, now before you say that it's because they're assassins, I feel Azir too is actually quite the assassin, with fair mobility, some burst and some sustained damage.

I don't feel that he was in an unhealthy state before (Bar the tower destroying (Seriously that was insane, he did it better than {{champion:24}} ) everything else was fine, i'd actually like to see the changes reverted, but I have a feeling riot won't do that.
yeah I love my azir, but he sucks in solo q now, I can't get ahead in the laning phase, and in many cases, the game is over if you wait it out for late game.

Yeah, He didn't have all that strong an early game before, he was EXTREMELY susceptible to ganks, given that to escape he needed to use all 3 abilities at once, being a heavy drain on his mana and also taking a large amount of time to do compared to the likes of Kat, Zed, Leblanc, Ahri, Kass, Yasuo, who's dashes/ blinks were near instant, I saw so many Azir QQ threads before his nerfs that were frankly unprecedented, and his ridiculous banrate seemed rather silly, having a very low winrate overall.

If he gets buffed I will happily ditch Viktor in return for Azir (OK I won't ditch Viktor, I love him, he's mine now)

>I think he COULD fit into all team comps if he got a little love but he needs too much help early game

While I agree, I also think that this is the exact problem with some of the newer champs coming out. Lee is always good, Thresh is always good, Kali is always good, Nidalee is always good, Zed is always good, Victor is always good+.
The problem with having champs that are always good, is they become an obstacle to diversity. You can Mid champ 1 who is the undisputed master of A, or you can have mid champ 2 who is almost as good at A, B, C, & D. There's not much reason to pick mid laner 1 in this case. Now you want another champ that can compete? Make another one do everything. Only now, you have a scenario where one will always be invalidated because the other is simply better.

I would like to see Azir become stronger in general. But it's simply no healthy for him, or the game overall. And he's rather strong right now, though incredibly niche. If he were to receive buffs, though should help reinforce his niche; not make him more of a generalist.

+Victor is kind of a new face on the block, but just you wait. The QQ will come.
Just revert the nerfs, except his tower damage one.

His Q base damage is what really makes me cringe. I'd say keep his soldier auto attack range the way it is and increase the Q base damage a bit more. Before I used to snipe my enemies from a Q skill shot and it would be the most satisfying feeling ever or trade with them in lane and come out even or even out duel them although this would only happen when they get close to my tower and I ult them into my tower. I would expect to kill them as they retreat but now with current Azir I don't. The base damage on his Q is really low compared to other mid laners base damages. To deal the same amount of damage I have to use his Q twice, mind you they'll be walking away from the soldiers range or if they were smart they'd take advantage of the long cooldowns and his extreamly low damage early game. I know people often compare him and Vayne being played as "late game hyper carries" but Vayne actually has a steroid once she hits 6 where Azir had a small  small that is actually quite easy to walk around. Main point is that I wish for his Q to receive minor base damage buffs. I was able to punish my enemies when they over extend, now they just walk away with a small amount of health as if the tower insec just didn't happen.

It does take a while for Azir to become a threat. I'd say around 15 mintues if fed to 20-25 if decent farm. I personally dont think winrate is indicative of anything bad with him even though he does have problems punishing bad plays. I agree with the person who said W shouldn't cost mana though.

if you look at the global champion base stats and compare them with azir, Azir is in the weakest spot for almost every stat (only mana pool is good but only because he require a lot of mana for his spell).
Actually the things are two from my point of view:
1) increase growing AS (so that in early you got low AS but in late you got a lot)
2) increase base HP or armor/MR
